Wisdom: الْكِبْرُ دَاعٍ إِلَى التَّقَحُّمِ فِي الذُّنُوبِ
enWisdom: Arrogance is an inviter towards plunging into sins

Wisdom: الْكِبْرُ خَلِيقَةٌ مُرْدِيَةٌ مَنْ تَكَثَّرَ بِهَا قَلَّ
enWisdom: Arrogance is a destructive trait, one who seeks to increase by it, diminishes

Wisdom: الْكِبْرُ يُسَاوِرُ الْقُلُوبَ مُسَاوَرَةَ السُّمُومِ الْقَاتِلَةِ
enWisdom: Arrogance grips the hearts just like a fatal poison

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَالتَّجَبُّرَ عَلَى عِبَادِ اللَّهِ فَإِنَّ كُلَّ مُتَجَبِّرٍ يَقْصِمُهُ اللَّهُ
enWisdom: Beware of behaving haughtily with the servants of Allah, for every haughty one is crushed by Allah
Due to arrogance there is loathing
Through increased arrogance, loss [and ruin] comes about
The arrogance of a lowly person invites his insult
The fruit of arrogance is vituperation
At times the haughty one is humiliated
Arrogance is sufficient as a [cause of] loss [and destruction]
The arrogant one has no friend
One who shows haughtiness is crushed
One who shows arrogance is loathed

Wisdom: مَنْ كَانَ مُتَكَبِّراً لَمْ يَعْدَمِ التَّلَفَ
enWisdom: One who is arrogant will not be devoid of loss [and injury]

Wisdom: مَنْ لَبِسَ الْكِبْرَ وَالسَّرَفَ خَلَعَ الْفَضْلَ وَالشَّرَفَ
enWisdom: One who wears the attires of arrogance and extravagance takes off the attires of merit and honour
Nothing brings hatred like arrogance does
There is no praise with arrogance
The actions of a haughty person are not pure [and righteous]
